intro: Mollugo racemosa, commonly known as the common sandmat, is a low-growing perennial plant native to sandy and coastal areas. It features prostrate or erect stems that produce small, white to pale yellow flowers in clusters. The plant has fleshy, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as dunes and roadsides. Mollugo racemosa is known for its ability to tolerate salt spray and sandy conditions, making it a hardy and resilient species.
